alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Judith Basin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 24 at 2:28AM MST until January 25 at 6:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches for elevations above 5000 feet, and 1 to 3 inches below 5000 feet. * WHERE...Cascade and Judith Basin Counties. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 6 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, particularly for travel over Kings Hill Pass, and along Highway 87 from around Belt to Stanford. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Peak snowfall rates are expected to occur this afternoon and evening. Initial snowfall could melt on road surfaces before icing over as temperatures fall overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
